intro: Phyllanthus atalotrichus, commonly known as the hairy phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers, which are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in dry shrublands, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. The hairy phyllanthus is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses reported in local herbal remedies.
